New Chapters book lists

Reading lists to help your wellbeing, including Books on Prescription.

Check out a health or medicine-related book from the longlist for the 2017 Wellcome Prize

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 30, 2017

Are you interested in health or medicine, or simply looking for something new and different to read? The 2017 Wellcome Prize longlist features fiction and non-fiction titles across several genres.

New moodboosting books for young people for 2017

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 10, 2017

Books for children from our Moodboosting collection.

Top titles about bullying for children and young adults for Anti Bullying Week 2016

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Nov 16, 2016

For Anti Bullying Week, we've put together a list of recommendations for children and young adults on the subject of bullying.

Reading Well for young people

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Apr 20, 2016

The Reading Well books recommended for young people are available to borrow from our libraries.

Health and wellbeing picks for September 2015

Written by David Grimmer · Published Sep 15, 2015

David Grimmer chooses The silver linings playbook by Matthew Quick this month.

Mental health at Edinburgh International Book Festival 2015

Written by Emma Raindle · Published Aug 4, 2015

Edinburgh International Book Festival is the largest bookfest in the world, running 15-31 August 2015. Here is a selection featured at the festival.

Health and wellbeing picks for August 2015

Written by David Grimmer · Published Aug 1, 2015

August picks include Rubbernecker by Belinda Bauer and The fault in our stars by John Green.

Health and wellbeing picks for July 2015

Written by David Grimmer · Published Jul 15, 2015

This month looks at Stonebird by Mike Revell which deals with dementia, and Perfect by Rachel Joyce which includes experiences with OCD.

Health and wellbeing picks for June 2015

Written by David Grimmer · Published Jun 1, 2015

This month we have recommendations from Sara at Bury St Edmunds Library and Tracey at Haverhill Library.

Health and wellbeing picks for May 2015

Written by David Grimmer · Published Apr 28, 2015

Costa-award winning fiction tackling mental health issues.

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
